Please help YAL with a donation to the SCV Sheriff’s Foundation today. Rebecca & I will be donating next month.

A special thanks to the parents and staff in Val Verde (especially Deputy Rooney) who make this happen. I will do all I can to preserve this incredible program.

YAL has been the gold standard for law enforcement involvement in local communities for over 30 years, but this program is now at risk. Unfortunately these types of programs are the first to be eliminated when politicians like @ChristyforCA25 defund the police...

Today I had the honor of visiting the Youth Activity League in Val Verde. YAL is an amazing program hosted by the local Sheriffs to provide after-school opportunities, tutoring, WiFi access, meals, sports, scholarships and many other things to the local kids in Val Verde... http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EkuWdT0UYAIQBBJ.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EkuWdT1VoAIhI1O.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EkuWdT4UcAAOXSL.jpg

It is an honor to introduce a resolution in the U.S. House of Representatives to establish October 23rd as a National Day of Remembrance of the 1983 Beirut bombing attack on U.S. Marines. #SemperFi 

https://pence.house.gov/media/press-releases/greg-pence-introduces-resolution-establish-national-day-remembrance-1983-beirut

I was able to come home to my wife, who was expecting our first child, and my family in Columbus. Unfortunately, so many of my friends and fellow Marines were not able to do so. 

I promised I would never forget them.

The tragic day in 1983 when an Iranian national drove a truck bomb into U.S. Marine Barracks in Beirut is forever ingrained in my heart. 

As a Beirut Veteran, I was shipped out of the Beirut barracks only days before this horrific attack on American lives. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ektw3EtXIAIiSEr.jpg

RT @Argus_Joe School days look a little different this fall. So @RepDustyJohnson arranged a substitute teaching gig to get a first-hand account...

https://www.argusleader.com/story/news/politics/2020/10/19/congressman-spends-day-substitute-teaching-middle-school/5984474002/

And finally,
5. These educators aren’t teaching one class at a time. They are teaching a “normal” one, one to students working remotely, one to students with limited English proficiency, one to students who are absent because of activities, etc. 

Be grateful for great teachers.
4. My middle schooler told me this morning not to “ruin his reputation.” His friends in the last block of the day told me I did okay, so I think I’m in the clear.
3. Teachers are incredibly passionate about what they do, just as they were back in my student days. Their biggest beef? Parents who aren’t engaged.
2. Teaching to remote learners is not easy. I’m not saying it isn’t a part of the answer. I’m just saying it’s harder.

A few observations from my great day as a #MiddleSchoolSubstitute:

1. These kids are great. Some people say the future is bleak. Maybe, but these kids have tons of potential.

For anyone who thinks being out of the classroom is a “day off” for the teacher, please note that the teacher I’m subbing for had FIVE PAGES of detailed notes for me, specific to today’s classes. It’s obvious that @allipierson is an incredible educator. #MiddleSchoolSubstitute http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ektx-fUWMAEMEUl.jpg

Another complexity added by COVID . . . most in-person instructional blocks also have students learning remotely, so educators need to use that technology in real time. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EktsLipXIAIftnn.jpg

Aside from social distancing and mask wearing, there are other COVID-19 precautions in place. For example, we disinfect surfaces at the end of every block. #MiddleSchoolSubstitute http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ekte9EhXUAIgtCv.jpg

School lunch of sweet chili chicken. 
Before and after. #MiddleSchoolSubstitute http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ekta1vgXIAUHgVN.jpg
Middle school has gotten rough and tumble in the last 30 years. An eighth grader just called me a “silly goose.” #MiddleSchoolSubstitute
If I would have known we’d be discussing the Hazelwood First Amendment case in Yearbook this morning, I would have had someone from @SD_Newspapers guest lecture!  #MiddleSchoolSubstitute
I’m working today as a substitute middle school English teacher. #Nervous http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EksfOTaXYAERa5c.jpg
